pullRequest.body:
We give a nice characterization for `log b x = y`. We then use it to prove a more general version of `log_opow_mul_add`, alongside other lemmas.

---

Looks good to me!
bors d+
Looks good to me!

```suggestion
theorem log_eq_iff {b x : Ordinal} (hb : 1 < b) (hx : x ≠ 0) (y : Ordinal) :
```

```suggestion
    log b x = y ↔ x ∈ Set.Ico (b ^ y) (b ^ succ y) := by
```

I'm inclined to say the rhs here should be two inequalities, which is also simp-normal-form for the rhs. Set.Ico is great when you want to describe a set, but the point here is that `x` satisfies two boundedness conditions. But this is optional
Sure, I'll change it to the inequality form.

```suggestion
  simpa using log_opow_mul_add hb hv (opow_pos u (zero_lt_one.trans hb))
```
might work here, and I think it looks a little cleaner? 

Also is there some pos_of_gt you can write instead of the zero_lt_one.trans hb

`pos_of_gt` has typeclass hypotheses too strong (hopefully the `CanonicallyOrdered` refactor fixes that). However, we can use `bot_lt_of_lt` here and in other places where we don't care for syntactic equality.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(SetTheory/Ordinal/Exponential): `log b x = y ↔ x ∈ Set.Ico (b ^ y) (b ^ (succ y))`
